channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Behavior of Crowds not Wisdom of Crowds
item.description: When behavioral crowds are roiling the markets, as they are now, best idea active equity has an excellent chance of outperforming.

item.title: Gen Z’s most notable status symbols, and the motivations behind them
item.description: Erewhon smoothies, thrifted Coach bags and platinum American Express cards are Gen Z's status symbols—and they signify a lot more than bank balance.

item.title: Is the Outright Ban on a US Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) a Mistake?
item.description: Instead of outright banning a US CBDC, wouldn’t it be preferrable to establish clear and enforceable legislative guardrails?

item.title: This is the ‘special sauce’ behind American exceptionalism—and why the U.S. stock market could continue dominating
item.description: “Many countries have these various advantages, but none have the combination—or the entire package—quite like the U.S. does,” RiverFront Investment Group’s chief strategist said.

item.title: Concerned About Market Concentration and Lofty Valuations? Consider Small Caps
item.description: Investors are showing increased concern about large-cap stocks due to high market concentration and lofty stock valuations. Other factors combine to make a compelling case for small caps.

item.title: Pets make for the best financial advisers and motivators. They force you to be more mindful about your spending, study shows
item.description: Pets inspire good money habits such as long-term investments and emergency savings.

item.title: What Is Systems Thinking? A Primer with Applications for Sustainable Investing
item.description: Systems thinking is gaining in popularity in many fields including economics, finance, and investment management. Learn what it means and how it's being applied to sustainable investing.

item.title: Deel CEO was told he’d need to replace his entire leadership team for the business to reach unicorn status—now it’s valued at $12 billion and he’s ‘kept 80% of the same team as when it was at $0’
item.description: Entrepreneurs perhaps expect to lose sleep when scaling their venture from the ground up into a unicorn—but Deel's founder Alex Bouaziz was warned he’d have to also lose his entire leadership team in the process.

item.title: Book Review: My Value Creation Journey
item.description: Bartley J. Madden has produced a book that challenges business leaders and investment professionals to think outside the box systematically to solve difficult problems.

item.title: The wealthy are dropping up to $10,000 a month on social wellness clubs to relax and reverse age with their peers
item.description: Members-only social wellness clubs offer curated experiences and luxury amenities.
